verses.text: And when the feast was finished, they indeed returned; but the Lord Jesus remained in the temple among the teachers and elders and learned men of the sons of Israel, to whom He put various questions upon the sciences, and gave answers in His turn.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:339
verses.text: For He said to them:  Whose son is the Messias?  They answered Him:  The son of David.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:340
verses.text: Wherefore then, said He, does he in the Spirit call him his lord, when he says, The Lord said to my lord, Sit at my right hand, that I may put thine enemies under thy footsteps?  Again the chief of the teachers said to Him:  Hast thou read the books?  Both the books, said the Lord Jesus, and the things contained in the books.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:341
verses.text: And He explained the books, and the law, and the precepts, and the statutes, and the mysteries, which are contained in the books of the prophetsthings which the understanding of no creature attains to.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:342
verses.text: That teacher therefore said:  I hitherto have neither attained to nor heard of such knowledge:  Who, pray, do you think that boy will be?.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:343
verses.text: And a philosopher who was there present, a skilful astronomer, asked the Lord Jesus whether He had studied astronomy.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:344
verses.text: And the Lord Jesus answered him, and explained the number of the spheres, and of the heavenly bodies, their natures and operations; their opposition; their aspect, triangular, square, and sextile; their course, direct and retrograde; the twenty-fourths, and sixtieths of twenty-fourths; and other things beyond the reach of reason.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:345
verses.text: There was also among those philosophers one very skilled in treating of natural science, and he asked the Lord Jesus whether He had studied medicine.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:346
verses.text: And He, in reply, explained to him physics and metaphysics, hyperphysics and hypophysics, the powers likewise and humours of the body, and the effects of the same; also the number of members and bones, of veins, arteries, and nerves; also the effect of heat and dryness, of cold and moisture, and what these give rise to; what was the operation of the soul upon the body, and its perceptions and powers; what was the operation of the faculty of speech, of anger, of desire; lastly, their conjunction and disjunction, and other things beyond the reach of any created intellect.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:347
verses.text: Then that philosopher rose up, and adored the Lord Jesus, and said:  O Lord, from this time I will be thy disciple and slave.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:348
verses.text: While they were speaking to each other of these and other things, the Lady Mary came, after having gone about seeking Him for three days along with Joseph.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:349
verses.text: She therefore, seeing Him sitting among the teachers asking them questions, and answering in His turn, said to Him:  My son, why hast thou treated us thus?  Behold, thy father and I have sought thee with great trouble.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:350
verses.text: But He said:  Why do you seek me?  Do you not know that I ought to occupy myself in my Father's house?  But they did not understand the words that He spoke to them.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:351
verses.text: Then those teachers asked Mary whether He were her son; and when she signified that He was, they said:  Blessed art thou, O Mary, who hast brought forth such a son.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:352
verses.text: And returning with them to Nazareth, He obeyed them in all things.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:353
verses.text: And His mother kept all these words of His in her heart.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:354
verses.text: And the Lord Jesus advanced in stature, and in wisdom, and in favour with God and man.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:355
verses.text: And from this day He began to hide His miracles and mysteries and secrets, and to give attention to the law, until He completed His thirtieth year, when His Father publicly declared Him at the Jordan by this voice sent down from heaven:  This is my beloved Son, in whom I am well pleased; the Holy Spirit being present in the form of a white dove.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:356
verses.text: This is He whom we adore with supplications, who hath given us being and life, and who hath brought us from our mothers' wombs; who for our sakes assumed a human body, and redeemed us, that He might embrace us in eternal compassion, and show to us His mercy according to His liberality, and beneficence, and generosity, and benevolence.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:357
verses.text: To Him is glory, and beneficence, and power, and dominion from this time forth for evermore,  Amen.

verses.name: Apocrypha: Arabic Gospel of the Infancy of the Saviour 1:358
verses.text: Here endeth the whole Gospel of the Infancy, with the aid of God Most High, according to what we have found in the original.
